Root.name: ActivityRecord
Root.Comment: Records activity for an entity at a point in time; activity may be for an event that has already occurred or for a planned activity.

Simple.name: mRID
Simple.Comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Simple.name: createdDateTime
Simple.Comment: Date and time this activity record has been created (different from the 'status.dateTime', which is the time of a status change of the associated object, if applicable).

Simple.name: description
Simple.Comment: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

Simple.name: name
Simple.Comment: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

Simple.name: reason
Simple.Comment: Reason for event resulting in this activity record, typically supplied when user initiated.

Simple.name: severity
Simple.Comment: Severity level of event resulting in this activity record.

Simple.name: type
Simple.Comment: Type of event resulting in this activity record.

EnumeratedType.name: AreaKind
EnumeratedType.Comment: Enumeration for the type of area defined; e.g., county, state, parish, zipcode, etc.

EnumeratedValue.name: borough
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Enumeration for the type of area defined for the borough

EnumeratedValue.name: county
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Enumeration for the type of area defined for the county

EnumeratedValue.name: parish
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Enumeration for the type of area defined for the parish

EnumeratedValue.name: serviceArea
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Enumeration for the type of area defined for the service area

EnumeratedValue.name: state
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Enumeration for the type of area defined for the state

EnumeratedValue.name: township
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Enumeration for the type of area defined for the township

EnumeratedValue.name: ward
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Enumeration for the type of area defined for the ward

EnumeratedValue.name: zipcode
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Enumeration for the type of area defined for the zipcode

ComplexType.name: ConductingEquipment
ComplexType.Comment: The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals.

Simple.name: mRID
Simple.Comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Simple.name: aliasName
Simple.Comment: The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

Simple.name: description
Simple.Comment: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

Simple.name: name
Simple.Comment: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

Reference.name: AssetDatasheet
Reference.Comment: Datasheet information for this power system resource.

Reference.name: Assets
Reference.Comment: All assets represented by this power system resource. For example, multiple conductor assets are electrically modelled as a single AC line segment.

Reference.name: Clearances
Reference.Comment: All clearances applicable to this power system resource.

Reference.name: ConfigurationEvent
Reference.Comment: All configuration events created for this Power System resource.

Reference.name: Controls
Reference.Comment: The controller outputs used to actually govern a regulating device, e.g. the magnetization of a synchronous machine or capacitor bank breaker actuator.

Reference.name: DiagramObjects
Reference.Comment: The diagram objects that are associated with the domain object.

Reference.name: GenericAction
Reference.Comment: The generic action that is performed on the power system resource

Reference.name: InstanceSet
Reference.Comment: Dataset containing the data objects.

Reference.name: Location
Reference.Comment: Location of this power system resource.

Reference.name: Measurements
Reference.Comment: The measurements associated with this power system resource.

Reference.name: Names
Reference.Comment: All names of this identified object.

Reference.name: OperatingShare
Reference.Comment: The operating shares of this power system resource.

Reference.name: OperationalTags
Reference.Comment: All operational tags placed on this power system resource.

Reference.name: PropertiesCIMDataObject
Reference.Comment: The single CIM data object in the appropriate dataset context.

Reference.name: PSREvents
Reference.Comment: All events associated with this power system resource.

Reference.name: PSRType
Reference.Comment: Custom classification for this power system resource.

Reference.name: ReportingGroup
Reference.Comment: Reporting groups to which this power system resource belongs.

Reference.name: TargetingCIMDataObject
Reference.Comment: Data objects registered.

Instance.name: VerificationAction
Instance.Comment: The verification action that is performed on the power system resource

Root.name: Crew
Root.Comment: Group of people with specific skills, tools, and vehicles.

Simple.name: mRID
Simple.Comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Simple.name: description
Simple.Comment: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

Simple.name: name
Simple.Comment: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

Reference.name: CrewMembers
Reference.Comment: All members of this crew.

Reference.name: CrewType
Reference.Comment: Type of this crew.

Reference.name: status
Reference.Comment: Status of this crew.

Reference.name: WorkAssets
Reference.Comment: All work assets used by this crew.

Reference.name: WorkTasks
Reference.Comment: All work tasks this crew participates in.

CompoundType.name: DateTimeInterval
CompoundType.Comment: Interval between two date and time points, where the interval includes the start time but excludes end time.

Simple.name: end
Simple.Comment: End date and time of this interval. The end date and time where the interval is defined up to, but excluded.

Simple.name: start
Simple.Comment: Start date and time of this interval. The start date and time is included in the defined interval.

Simple.name: email1
Simple.Comment: Primary email address.

ComplexType.name: Equipment
ComplexType.Comment: The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanical.

Simple.name: mRID
Simple.Comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Simple.name: inService
Simple.Comment: Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

Simple.name: normallyInService
Simple.Comment: Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

Instance.name: Names
Instance.Comment: All names of this identified object.

Root.name: Fault
Root.Comment: Abnormal condition causing current flow through conducting equipment, such as caused by equipment failure or short circuits from objects not typically modelled (for example, a tree falling on a line).

Simple.name: occurredDateTime
Simple.Comment: The date and time at which the fault occurred.

Reference.name: phases
Reference.Comment: The phases participating in the fault. The fault connections into these phases are further specified by the type of fault.

Instance.name: FaultCauseTypes
Instance.Comment: All types of fault cause.

Instance.name: FaultyEquipment
Instance.Comment: Equipment carrying this fault.

ComplexType.name: FaultCauseType
ComplexType.Comment: Type of cause of the fault.

Simple.name: mRID
Simple.Comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Simple.name: description
Simple.Comment: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

ComplexType.name: FieldDispatchHistory
ComplexType.Comment: The history of field dispatch statuses for this work.

Instance.name: Crew
Instance.Comment: The crew that has this field dispatch history.

Instance.name: PlannedOutage
Instance.Comment: The planned outage that has the field dispatch history.

Reference.name: UnplannedOutage
Reference.Comment: The unplanned outage that has the field dispatch history.

ComplexType.name: Incident
ComplexType.Comment: Description of a problem in the field that may be reported in a trouble ticket or come from another source. It may have to do with an outage.

Simple.name: cause
Simple.Comment: Cause of this incident.

Simple.name: comment
Simple.Comment: Free text comment.

Simple.name: createdDateTime
Simple.Comment: Date and time that this document was created.

Simple.name: subject
Simple.Comment: Document subject.

Simple.name: title
Simple.Comment: Document title.

ComplexType.name: Name
ComplexType.Comment: The Name class provides the means to define any number of human readable names for an object. A name is not to be used for defining inter-object relationships. For inter-object relationships instead use the object identification 'mRID'.

Simple.name: name
Simple.Comment: Any free text that name the object.

Reference.name: IdentifiedObject
Reference.Comment: Identified object that this name designates.

Instance.name: NameType
Instance.Comment: Type of this name.

ComplexType.name: NameType
ComplexType.Comment: Type of name. Possible values for attribute 'name' are implementation dependent but standard profiles may specify types. An enterprise may have multiple IT systems each having its own local name for the same object, e.g. a planning system may have different names from an EMS. An object may also have different names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14. The definition from CIM14 is:

The localName is a human readable name of the object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation, VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have names that typically are unique among them.

Root.name: Outage
Root.Comment: Document describing details of an active or planned outage in a part of the electrical network.
A non-planned outage may be created upon:
- a breaker trip,
- a fault indicator status change,
- a meter event indicating customer outage,
- a reception of one or more customer trouble calls, or
- an operator command, reflecting information obtained from the field crew.
Outage restoration may be performed using a switching plan which complements the outage information with detailed switching activities, including the relationship to the crew and work.
A planned outage may be created upon:
- a request for service, maintenance or construction work in the field, or
- an operator-defined outage for what-if/contingency network analysis.

Simple.name: cause
Simple.Comment: The cause of this outage. This is the cause that is used to present to external entities. That is, the cause is weather, equipment failure, etc.
Note: At present, this is a free string text; it could be replaced with an enumeration in the future.

Reference.name: causeKind
Reference.Comment: The possible cause that could be associated with this unplanned outage.

Simple.name: createdDateTime
Simple.Comment: Date and time that this document was created.

Simple.name: customersRestored
Simple.Comment: number of customers that have been restored in the area.

Simple.name: lastModifiedDateTime
Simple.Comment: Date and time this document was last modified. Documents may potentially be modified many times during their lifetime.

Simple.name: metersAffected
Simple.Comment: The updated number of meters affected by the outage as reported by the OMS within the utility. It is assumed this number will be updated repeatedly until the full outage is resolved.

Simple.name: originalCustomersServed
Simple.Comment: the total number of customers that are served in the area (both outaged and not outaged).

Simple.name: originalMetersAffected
Simple.Comment: The original number of meters that were affected as reported by the OMS within the utility. That is, this is the total number of meters that were out at the beginning of the outage.

Reference.name: outageKind
Reference.Comment: Defines if the outage has been verified or is only estimated

Simple.name: reason
Simple.Comment: The reason for the planned outage.

Simple.name: reportedStartTime
Simple.Comment: The earliest start time of the Outage - as reported by some system or individual

Reference.name: statusKind
Reference.Comment: defines the status of the crew as in dispatched or arrived, etc.

Simple.name: subject
Simple.Comment: Document subject.

Simple.name: title
Simple.Comment: Document title.

Simple.name: type
Simple.Comment: Utility-specific classification of this document, according to its corporate standards, practices, and existing IT systems (e.g., for management of assets, maintenance, work, outage, customers, etc.).

Instance.name: ActivityRecord
Instance.Comment: The activity record for a document

Instance.name: actualPeriod
Instance.Comment: Actual outage period; end of the period corresponds to the actual restoration time.

Instance.name: DeEnergizedUsagePoint
Instance.Comment: all deenergized useage points associated with the outage.

Instance.name: docStatus
Instance.Comment: Status of this document. For status of subject matter this document represents (e.g., Agreement, Work), use 'status' attribute.
Example values for 'docStatus.status' are draft, approved, cancelled, etc.

Instance.name: electronicAddress
Instance.Comment: Electronic address.

Instance.name: EnergizedUsagePoint
Instance.Comment: All energized usage points associated with this outage.

Instance.name: Equipments
Instance.Comment: All equipments associated with this outage.

Instance.name: estimatedPeriod
Instance.Comment: Estimated outage period for a planned outage. The start of the period is the start of the planned outage and the end of the period corresponds to the end of the planned outage.

Instance.name: Faults
Instance.Comment: All faults involved in this outage.

Instance.name: FieldDispatchHistory
Instance.Comment: The dispatch history associated with the unplanned outage

Instance.name: FieldDispatchHistory
Instance.Comment: The dispatch history associated with the planned outage

Instance.name: Incident
Instance.Comment: The incidents that are associated with the unplanned outage

Instance.name: Incident
Instance.Comment: Incident reported in trouble call that results in this outage.

Instance.name: OutageArea
Instance.Comment: The outage area where the outage occured.

Instance.name: OutageIsolationEquipment
Instance.Comment: The equipment that isolates this outage

Instance.name: OutagePlan
Instance.Comment: Outage plan for executing a planned outage.

Instance.name: PlannedSwitchActions
Instance.Comment: All switch actions to apply within the scope of this planned outage. Each such action groups switches to which the action is to apply in order to produce the desired network state considered as outage.

Instance.name: status
Instance.Comment: Status of subject matter (e.g., Agreement, Work) this document represents. For status of the document itself, use 'docStatus' attribute.

Instance.name: summary
Instance.Comment: Summary counts of service points (customers) affected by this outage.

Instance.name: SwitchingPlans
Instance.Comment: All switching plans that lead to supply restoration due to this outage. Only one will be retained for execution.

Instance.name: TroubleOrder
Instance.Comment: The trouble order that is associated to the unplanned outage.

Instance.name: TroubleTicket
Instance.Comment: The ticket called in by the customer that describes the trouble

Root.name: OutageArea
Root.Comment: This defines the area covered by the Outage.

Simple.name: earliestReportedTime
Simple.Comment: This is the reported time of the first outage report

Simple.name: metersServed
Simple.Comment: defines the number of meters served in the defined area.

Enumerated.name: outageAreaKind
Enumerated.Comment: defines the type of area that has the outage - county, state, zipcode, etc.

Root.name: OutagePlan
Root.Comment: Document containing the definition of planned outages of equipment and/or usage points. It will reference switching plans that are used to execute the planned outage.

Simple.name: mRID
Simple.Comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Simple.name: approvedDateTime
Simple.Comment: The date and time the outage plan was approved

Simple.name: cancelledDateTime
Simple.Comment: Date and Time the planned outage was canceled.

Simple.name: comment
Simple.Comment: Free text comment.

Simple.name: description
Simple.Comment: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

Simple.name: purpose
Simple.Comment: Purpose of this outage plan, such as whether it is to replace equipment or perform maintenance or repairs or to reconfigure network topology.

Simple.name: subject
Simple.Comment: Document subject.

Simple.name: title
Simple.Comment: Document title.

EnumeratedType.name: PhaseConnectedFaultKind
EnumeratedType.Comment: The type of fault connection among phases.

EnumeratedValue.name: lineOpen
EnumeratedValue.Comment: The fault is when the conductor path is broken between two terminals. Additional coexisting faults may be required if the broken conductor also causes connections to grounds or other lines or phases.

EnumeratedValue.name: lineToGround
EnumeratedValue.Comment: The fault connects the indicated phases to ground. The line to line fault impedance is not used and assumed infinite. The full ground impedance is connected between each phase specified in the fault and ground, but not between the phases.

EnumeratedValue.name: lineToLine
EnumeratedValue.Comment: The fault connects the specified phases together without a connection to ground. The ground impedance of this fault is ignored. The line to line impedance is connected between each of the phases specified in the fault. For example three times for a three phase fault, one time for a two phase fault. A single phase fault should not be specified.

EnumeratedValue.name: lineToLineToGround
EnumeratedValue.Comment: The fault connects the indicated phases to ground and to each other. The line to line impedance is connected between each of the phases specified in the fault in a full mesh. For example three times for a three phase fault, one time for a two phase fault. A single phase fault should not be specified. The full ground impedance is connected between each phase specified in the fault and ground.

Simple.name: mRID
Simple.Comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Simple.name: description
Simple.Comment: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

Simple.name: reason
Simple.Comment: The reason for the planned outage.

Reference.name: OutagePlan
Reference.Comment: Outage plan for executing a planned outage.

CompoundType.name: ServicePointOutageSummary
CompoundType.Comment: Summary counts of service points affected by an outage. These counts are sometimes referred to as total and critical customer count.

Simple.name: criticalCount
Simple.Comment: Number of critical service (delivery) points affected by an outage.

Simple.name: totalCount
Simple.Comment: Number of all service (delivery) points affected by an outage.

CompoundType.name: Status
CompoundType.Comment: Current status information relevant to an entity.

Simple.name: dateTime
Simple.Comment: Date and time for which status 'value' applies.

Simple.name: reason
Simple.Comment: Reason code or explanation for why an object went to the current status 'value'.

Simple.name: remark
Simple.Comment: Pertinent information regarding the current 'value', as free form text.

Simple.name: value
Simple.Comment: Status value at 'dateTime'; prior status changes may have been kept in instances of activity records associated with the object to which this status applies.

Root.name: SwitchAction
Root.Comment: Action on switch as a switching step.

Simple.name: executedDateTime
Simple.Comment: Actual date and time of this switching step.

Reference.name: phases
Reference.Comment: Phases of the Switching Action

Simple.name: plannedDateTime
Simple.Comment: Planned date and time of this switching step.

EnumeratedValue.name: close
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Close the switch.

EnumeratedValue.name: disableReclosing
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Disable (automatic) switch reclosing.

EnumeratedValue.name: enableReclosing
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Enable (automatic) switch reclosing.

EnumeratedValue.name: open
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Open the switch.

Root.name: SwitchingPlan
Root.Comment: A sequence of grouped or atomic steps intended to:
- de-energise equipment or part of the network for safe work, and/or
- bring back in service previously de-energised equipment or part of the network.

Simple.name: approvedDateTime
Simple.Comment: The date and time the switching plan was approved

Simple.name: createdDateTime
Simple.Comment: Date and time that this document was created.

Simple.name: lastModifiedDateTime
Simple.Comment: Date and time this document was last modified. Documents may potentially be modified many times during their lifetime.

Simple.name: purpose
Simple.Comment: Purpose of this plan, such as whether it is to move the state from normal to some abnormal condition, or to restore the normal state after an abnormal condition, or to perform some kind of optimisation such as correction of overload, voltage control, etc.

Simple.name: subject
Simple.Comment: Document subject.

Simple.name: title
Simple.Comment: Document title.

Root.name: TroubleOrder
Root.Comment: Trouble order sends an incident to a crew to initiate a response to an unplanned outage.

Simple.name: mRID
Simple.Comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Simple.name: comment
Simple.Comment: Free-form comment associated with the trouble order.

Simple.name: description
Simple.Comment: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

Reference.name: Approver
Reference.Comment: Approver of this document.

Reference.name: docStatus
Reference.Comment: Status of this document. For status of subject matter this document represents (e.g., Agreement, Work), use 'status' attribute.
Example values for 'docStatus.status' are draft, approved, cancelled, etc.

Reference.name: plannedExecutionInterval
Reference.Comment: The planned start and end time for the trouble order.

Reference.name: status
Reference.Comment: Status of subject matter (e.g., Agreement, Work) this document represents. For status of the document itself, use 'docStatus' attribute.

EnumeratedValue.name: call
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Trouble call received by customer service representative.

EnumeratedValue.name: email
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Trouble reported by email.

EnumeratedValue.name: ivr
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Trouble reported through interactive voice response system.

EnumeratedValue.name: letter
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Trouble reported by letter.

EnumeratedValue.name: other
EnumeratedValue.Comment: Trouble reported by other means.

Simple.name: mRID
Simple.Comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Simple.name: comment
Simple.Comment: Free-form comment associated with the trouble call for example, "customer reported a large flash", etc.

Simple.name: dateTimeOfReport
Simple.Comment: Date and time the trouble has been reported.

Simple.name: description
Simple.Comment: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

Simple.name: firstResponderStatus
Simple.Comment: Indicates whether the first responder such as police, fire department etc.has been notified and whether they are on site or en route.

Simple.name: multiplePremises
Simple.Comment: Set to true if the outage report indicated that other neighbors are also out of power.

Enumerated.name: reportingKind
Enumerated.Comment: Indicates how the customer reported trouble.

Simple.name: resolvedDateTime
Simple.Comment: Date and time this trouble ticket has been resolved.

Simple.name: troubleCode
Simple.Comment: Trouble code (e.g., power down, flickering lights, partial power, etc).

Reference.name: docStatus
Reference.Comment: Status of this document. For status of subject matter this document represents (e.g., Agreement, Work), use 'status' attribute.
Example values for 'docStatus.status' are draft, approved, cancelled, etc.

Reference.name: status
Reference.Comment: Status of subject matter (e.g., Agreement, Work) this document represents. For status of the document itself, use 'docStatus' attribute.

ComplexType.name: UsagePoint
ComplexType.Comment: Logical or physical point in the network to which readings or events may be attributed. Used at the place where a physical or virtual meter may be located; however, it is not required that a meter be present.

Reference.name: phaseCode
Reference.Comment: Phase code. Number of wires and specific nominal phases can be deduced from enumeration literal values. For example, ABCN is three-phase, four-wire, s12n (splitSecondary12N) is single-phase, three-wire, and s1n and s2n are single-phase, two-wire.

Domain.name: ratedCurrent
Domain.Comment: Current flow that this usage point is configured to deliver.

Domain.name: ratedPower
Domain.Comment: Active power that this usage point is configured to deliver.

Reference.name: EndDevices
Reference.Comment: All end devices at this usage point.

ComplexType.name: VerificationAction
ComplexType.Comment: Verification of a switch position or other condition as a switching step

Simple.name: description
Simple.Comment: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

Simple.name: executedDateTime
Simple.Comment: Actual date and time of this switching step.

Reference.name: phases
Reference.Comment: Phases of the Switching Action

Simple.name: verificationCondition
Simple.Comment: freeform description of the condition to be verified

SimpleType.name: CurrentFlow
SimpleType.Comment: Electrical current with sign convention: positive flow is out of the conducting equipment into the connectivity node. Can be both AC and DC.

SimpleType.name: ActivePower
SimpleType.Comment: Product of RMS value of the voltage and the RMS value of the in-phase component of the current.
